00012 class core_exec_STM_t:public core_exec_t
00013 {
00014   /* readyQ for scheduling */
00015   struct readyQ_node_t {
00016     struct uop_t * uop;
00017     seq_t uop_seq; /* seq id of uop when inserted - for proper sorting even after uop recycled */
00018     seq_t action_id;
00019     tick_t when_assigned;
00020     struct readyQ_node_t * next;
00021   };
00022 
00023   /* struct for a squashable in-flight uop (for example, a uop making its way
00024      down an ALU pipeline).  Changing the original uop's tag will make the tags
00025      no longer match, thereby invalidating the in-flight action. */
00026   struct uop_action_t {
00027     struct uop_t * uop;
00028     seq_t action_id;
00029     tick_t pipe_exit_time;
00030   };
00031 
00032   /* struct for a generic pipelined ALU */
00033   struct ALU_t {
00034     struct uop_action_t * pipe; /* implemented as min-heap */
00035     int occupancy;
00036     int latency;    /* number of cycles from start of execution to end */
00037     int issue_rate; /* number of cycles between issuing independent instructions on this ALU */
00038     tick_t when_executable; /* cycle when next instruction can actually start executing on this ALU */
00039   };
00040

00042

00163 core_exec_STM_t::core_exec_STM_t(struct core_t * arg_core):

00171   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = arg_core->knobs;
00172   core = arg_core;
00173 
00174   RS = (struct uop_t**) calloc(knobs->exec.RS_size,sizeof(*RS));
00175   if(!RS)
00176     fatal("couldn't calloc RS");

00179   if(!LDQ)
00180     fatal("couldn't calloc LDQ");

00182   STQ = (core_exec_STM_t::STQ_t*) calloc(knobs->exec.STQ_size,sizeof(*STQ));
00183   if(!STQ)
00184     fatal("couldn't calloc STQ");
00185 
00186   int i;
00187   /* This shouldn't be necessary, but I threw it in because valgrind (memcheck) was reporting
00188      that STQ[i].sta was being used uninitialized. */
00189   for(i=0;i<knobs->exec.STQ_size;i++)
00190     STQ[i].sta = NULL;
00191 
00192   /*********************************************************/
00193   /* Data cache parsing first, functional units after this */
00194   /*********************************************************/
00195   char name[256];
00196   int sets, assoc, linesize, latency, banks, bank_width, MSHR_entries, WBB_entries;
00197   char rp, ap, wp, wc;
00198   
00199   /* note: caches must be instantiated from the level furthest from the core first (e.g., LLC) */
00200 
00201   /* per-core DL2 */
00202 
00203   /* per-core L2 bus (between L1 and L2) */
00204   if(!strcasecmp(knobs->memory.DL2_opt_str,"none"))
00205   {
00206     core->memory.DL2 = NULL;
00207     core->memory.DL2_bus = NULL;
00208   }
00209   else
00210   {
00211     if(sscanf(knobs->memory.DL2_opt_str,"%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c:%c:%c:%d:%d:%c",
00212         name,&sets,&assoc,&linesize,&banks,&bank_width,&latency,&rp,&ap,&wp, &MSHR_entries, &WBB_entries, &wc) != 13)
00213       fatal("invalid DL2 options: <name:sets:assoc:linesize:banks:bank-width:latency:repl-policy:alloc-policy:write-policy:num-MSHR:WB-buffers:write-combining>\n\t(%s)",knobs->memory.DL2_opt_str);
00214     core->memory.DL2 = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READWRITE,sets,assoc,linesize,
00215                              rp,ap,wp,wc,banks,bank_width,latency,
00216                              WBB_entries,MSHR_entries,1,core->uncore->LLC,core->uncore->LLC_bus);
00217 
00218     if(!knobs->memory.DL2_MSHR_cmd || !strcasecmp(knobs->memory.DL2_MSHR_cmd,"fcfs"))
00219       core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order = NULL;
00220     else
00221     {
00222       if(strlen(knobs->memory.DL2_MSHR_cmd) != 4)
00223         fatal("-dl1:mshr_cmd must either be \"fcfs\" or contain all four of [RWBP]");
00224       bool R_seen = false;
00225       bool W_seen = false;
00226       bool B_seen = false;
00227       bool P_seen = false;
00228 
00229       core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order = (enum cache_command*)calloc(4,sizeof(enum cache_command));
00230       if(!core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order)
00231         fatal("failed to calloc MSHR_cmd_order array for DL2");
00232 
00233       for(int c=0;c<4;c++)
00234       {
00235         switch(mytoupper(knobs->memory.DL2_MSHR_cmd[c]))
00236         {
00237           case 'R': core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_READ; R_seen = true; break;
00238           case 'W': core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_WRITE; W_seen = true; break;
00239           case 'B': core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_WRITEBACK; B_seen = true; break;
00240           case 'P': core->memory.DL2->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_PREFETCH; P_seen = true; break;
00241           default: fatal("unknown cache operation '%c' for -dl1:mshr_cmd; must be one of [RWBP]");
00242         }
00243       }
00244       if(!R_seen || !W_seen || !B_seen || !P_seen)
00245         fatal("-dl1:mshr_cmd must contain *each* of [RWBP]");
00246     }
00247 
00248     core->memory.DL2->prefetcher = (struct prefetch_t**) calloc(knobs->memory.DL2_num_PF,sizeof(*core->memory.DL2->prefetcher));
00249     core->memory.DL2->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.DL2_num_PF;
00250     if(!core->memory.DL2->prefetcher)
00251       fatal("couldn't calloc %s's prefetcher array",core->memory.DL2->name);
00252     for(i=0;i<knobs->memory.DL2_num_PF;i++)
00253       core->memory.DL2->prefetcher[i] = prefetch_create(knobs->memory.DL2PF_opt_str[i],core->memory.DL2);
00254     if(core->memory.DL2->prefetcher[0] == NULL)
00255       core->memory.DL2->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.DL2_num_PF = 0;
00256     core->memory.DL2->prefetch_on_miss = knobs->memory.DL2_PF_on_miss;
00257 
00258     core->memory.DL2->PFF_size = knobs->memory.DL2_PFFsize;
00259     core->memory.DL2->PFF = (cache_t::PFF_t*) calloc(knobs->memory.DL2_PFFsize,sizeof(*core->memory.DL2->PFF));
00260     if(!core->memory.DL2->PFF)
00261       fatal("failed to calloc %s's prefetch FIFO",core->memory.DL2->name);
00262     core->memory.DL2->prefetch_threshold = knobs->memory.DL2_PFthresh;
00263     core->memory.DL2->prefetch_max = knobs->memory.DL2_PFmax;
00264     core->memory.DL2->PF_low_watermark = knobs->memory.DL2_low_watermark;
00265     core->memory.DL2->PF_high_watermark = knobs->memory.DL2_high_watermark;
00266     core->memory.DL2->PF_sample_interval = knobs->memory.DL2_WMinterval;
00267 
00268     core->memory.DL2_bus = bus_create("DL2_bus",core->memory.DL2->linesize,1);
00269   }
00270 
00271   /* per-core DL1 */
00272   if(sscanf(knobs->memory.DL1_opt_str,"%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c:%c:%c:%d:%d:%c",
00273       name,&sets,&assoc,&linesize,&banks,&bank_width,&latency,&rp,&ap,&wp, &MSHR_entries, &WBB_entries, &wc) != 13)
00274     fatal("invalid DL1 options: <name:sets:assoc:linesize:banks:bank-width:latency:repl-policy:alloc-policy:write-policy:num-MSHR:WB-buffers:write-combining>\n\t(%s)",knobs->memory.DL1_opt_str);
00275 
00276   if(core->memory.DL2)
00277     core->memory.DL1 = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READWRITE,sets,assoc,linesize,
00278                              rp,ap,wp,wc,banks,bank_width,latency,
00279                              WBB_entries,MSHR_entries,1,core->memory.DL2,core->memory.DL2_bus);
00280   else
00281     core->memory.DL1 = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READWRITE,sets,assoc,linesize,
00282                              rp,ap,wp,wc,banks,bank_width,latency,
00283                              WBB_entries,MSHR_entries,1,core->uncore->LLC,core->uncore->LLC_bus);
00284   if(!knobs->memory.DL1_MSHR_cmd || !strcasecmp(knobs->memory.DL1_MSHR_cmd,"fcfs"))
00285     core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order = NULL;
00286   else
00287   {
00288     if(strlen(knobs->memory.DL1_MSHR_cmd) != 4)
00289       fatal("-dl1:mshr_cmd must either be \"fcfs\" or contain all four of [RWBP]");
00290     bool R_seen = false;
00291     bool W_seen = false;
00292     bool B_seen = false;
00293     bool P_seen = false;
00294 
00295     core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order = (enum cache_command*)calloc(4,sizeof(enum cache_command));
00296     if(!core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order)
00297       fatal("failed to calloc MSHR_cmd_order array for DL1");
00298 
00299     for(int c=0;c<4;c++)
00300     {
00301       switch(mytoupper(knobs->memory.DL1_MSHR_cmd[c]))
00302       {
00303         case 'R': core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_READ; R_seen = true; break;
00304         case 'W': core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_WRITE; W_seen = true; break;
00305         case 'B': core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_WRITEBACK; B_seen = true; break;
00306         case 'P': core->memory.DL1->MSHR_cmd_order[c] = CACHE_PREFETCH; P_seen = true; break;
00307         default: fatal("unknown cache operation '%c' for -dl1:mshr_cmd; must be one of [RWBP]");
00308       }
00309     }
00310     if(!R_seen || !W_seen || !B_seen || !P_seen)
00311       fatal("-dl1:mshr_cmd must contain *each* of [RWBP]");
00312   }
00313 
00314   core->memory.DL1->prefetcher = (struct prefetch_t**) calloc(knobs->memory.DL1_num_PF,sizeof(*core->memory.DL1->prefetcher));
00315   core->memory.DL1->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.DL1_num_PF;
00316   if(!core->memory.DL1->prefetcher)
00317     fatal("couldn't calloc %s's prefetcher array",core->memory.DL1->name);
00318   for(i=0;i<knobs->memory.DL1_num_PF;i++)
00319     core->memory.DL1->prefetcher[i] = prefetch_create(knobs->memory.DL1PF_opt_str[i],core->memory.DL1);
00320   if(core->memory.DL1->prefetcher[0] == NULL)
00321     core->memory.DL1->num_prefetchers = knobs->memory.DL1_num_PF = 0;
00322   core->memory.DL1->prefetch_on_miss = knobs->memory.DL1_PF_on_miss;
00323 
00324   core->memory.DL1->PFF_size = knobs->memory.DL1_PFFsize;
00325   core->memory.DL1->PFF = (cache_t::PFF_t*) calloc(knobs->memory.DL1_PFFsize,sizeof(*core->memory.DL1->PFF));
00326   if(!core->memory.DL1->PFF)
00327     fatal("failed to calloc %s's prefetch FIFO",core->memory.DL1->name);
00328   core->memory.DL1->prefetch_threshold = knobs->memory.DL1_PFthresh;
00329   core->memory.DL1->prefetch_max = knobs->memory.DL1_PFmax;
00330   core->memory.DL1->PF_low_watermark = knobs->memory.DL1_low_watermark;
00331   core->memory.DL1->PF_high_watermark = knobs->memory.DL1_high_watermark;
00332   core->memory.DL1->PF_sample_interval = knobs->memory.DL1_WMinterval;
00333 
00334 
00335   /* DTLB2 */
00336   if(strcasecmp(knobs->memory.DTLB2_opt_str,"none") != 0)
00337     warnonce("DTLB2 not used in STM model; option string ignored");
00338   core->memory.DTLB_bus = NULL;
00339   core->memory.DTLB2 = NULL;
00340 
00341   /* DTLB */
00342   if(sscanf(knobs->memory.DTLB_opt_str,"%[^:]:%d:%d:%d:%d:%c:%d",
00343       name,&sets,&assoc,&banks,&latency, &rp, &MSHR_entries) != 7)
00344     fatal("invalid DTLB options: <name:sets:assoc:banks:latency:repl-policy:num-MSHR>");
00345 
00346   if(core->memory.DL2)
00347     core->memory.DTLB = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,1,rp,'w','t','n',banks,1,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->memory.DL2,core->memory.DL2_bus);
00348   else
00349     core->memory.DTLB = cache_create(core,name,CACHE_READONLY,sets,assoc,1,rp,'w','t','n',banks,1,latency,4,MSHR_entries,1,core->uncore->LLC,core->uncore->LLC_bus);
00350   core->memory.DTLB->MSHR_cmd_order = NULL;
00351 
00352   /*******************/
00353   /* execution ports */
00354   /*******************/
00355   port = (core_exec_STM_t::exec_port_t*) calloc(knobs->exec.num_exec_ports,sizeof(*port));
00356   if(!port)
00357     fatal("couldn't calloc exec ports");
00358 
00359   /***************************/
00360   /* execution port bindings */
00361   /***************************/
00362   for(i=0;i<NUM_FU_CLASSES;i++)
00363   {
00364     int j;
00365     knobs->exec.port_binding[i].ports = (int*) calloc(knobs->exec.port_binding[i].num_FUs,sizeof(int));
00366     if(!knobs->exec.port_binding[i].ports) fatal("couldn't calloc %s ports",MD_FU_NAME(i));
00367     for(j=0;j<knobs->exec.port_binding[i].num_FUs;j++)
00368     {
00369       if((knobs->exec.fu_bindings[i][j] < 0) || (knobs->exec.fu_bindings[i][j] >= knobs->exec.num_exec_ports))
00370         fatal("port binding for %s is negative or exceeds the execution width (should be > 0 and < %d)",MD_FU_NAME(i),knobs->exec.num_exec_ports);
00371       knobs->exec.port_binding[i].ports[j] = knobs->exec.fu_bindings[i][j];
00372     }
00373   }
00374 
00375   /***************************************/
00376   /* functional unit execution pipelines */
00377   /***************************************/
00378   for(i=0;i<NUM_FU_CLASSES;i++)
00379   {
00380     int j;
00381     for(j=0;j<knobs->exec.port_binding[i].num_FUs;j++)
00382     {
00383       int port_num = knobs->exec.port_binding[i].ports[j];
00384       int latency = knobs->exec.latency[i];
00385       int issue_rate = knobs->exec.issue_rate[i];
00386       int heap_size = 1<<((int)rint(ceil(log(latency+1)/log(2.0))));
00387       port[port_num].FU[i] = (struct ALU_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(struct ALU_t));
00388       if(!port[port_num].FU[i])
00389         fatal("couldn't calloc IEU");
00390       port[port_num].FU[i]->latency = latency;
00391       port[port_num].FU[i]->issue_rate = issue_rate;
00392       port[port_num].FU[i]->pipe = (struct uop_action_t*) calloc(heap_size,sizeof(struct uop_action_t));
00393       if(!port[port_num].FU[i]->pipe)
00394         fatal("couldn't calloc %s function unit execution pipeline",MD_FU_NAME(i));
00395 
00396       if(i==FU_LD) /* load has AGEN and STQ access pipelines */
00397       {
00398         port[port_num].STQ = (struct ALU_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(struct ALU_t));
00399         latency = core->memory.DL1->latency; /* assume STQ latency matched to DL1's */
00400         heap_size = 1<<((int)rint(ceil(log(latency+1)/log(2.0))));
00401         port[port_num].STQ->latency = latency;
00402         port[port_num].STQ->issue_rate = issue_rate;
00403         port[port_num].STQ->pipe = (struct uop_action_t*) calloc(heap_size,sizeof(struct uop_action_t));
00404         if(!port[port_num].STQ->pipe)
00405           fatal("couldn't calloc load's STQ exec pipe on port %d",j);
00406       }
00407     }
00408   }
00409 
00410   /* shortened list of the FU's available on each port (to speed up FU loop in ALU_exec) */
00411   for(i=0;i<knobs->exec.num_exec_ports;i++)
00412   {
00413     port[i].num_FU_types = 0;
00414     int j;
00415     for(j=0;j<NUM_FU_CLASSES;j++)
00416       if(port[i].FU[j])
00417         port[i].num_FU_types++;
00418     port[i].FU_types = (enum md_fu_class *)calloc(port[i].num_FU_types,sizeof(enum md_fu_class));
00419     if(!port[i].FU_types)
00420       fatal("couldn't calloc FU_types array on port %d",i);
00421     int k=0;
00422     for(j=0;j<NUM_FU_CLASSES;j++)
00423     {
00424       if(port[i].FU[j])
00425       {
00426         port[i].FU_types[k] = (enum md_fu_class)j;
00427         k++;
00428       }
00429     }
00430   }
00431   check_for_work = true;
00432 }
00433 
00434 void
00435 core_exec_STM_t::reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t *sdb)
00436 {
00437   char buf[1024];
00438   char buf2[1024];
00439   struct thread_t * arch = core->current_thread;
00440 
00441   stat_reg_note(sdb,"#### EXEC STATS ####");
00442   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_uops_issued",arch->id);
00443   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "number of uops issued", &core->stat.exec_uops_issued, core->stat.exec_uops_issued, NULL);
00444   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_uPC",arch->id);
00445   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.exec_uops_issued/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00446   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average number of uops executed per cycle", buf2, NULL);
00447   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_uops_replayed",arch->id);
00448   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "number of uops replayed", &core->stat.exec_uops_replayed, core->stat.exec_uops_replayed, NULL);
00449   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_avg_replays",arch->id);
00450   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.exec_uops_replayed/c%d.exec_uops_issued",arch->id,arch->id);
00451   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average replays per uop", buf2, NULL);
00452   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_uops_snatched",arch->id);
00453   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "number of uops snatched-back", &core->stat.exec_uops_snatched_back, core->stat.exec_uops_snatched_back, NULL);
00454   sprintf(buf,"c%d.exec_avg_snatched",arch->id);
00455   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.exec_uops_snatched/c%d.exec_uops_issued",arch->id,arch->id);
00456   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average snatch-backs per uop", buf2, NULL);
00457   sprintf(buf,"c%d.num_jeclear",arch->id);
00458   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "number of branch mispredictions", &core->stat.num_jeclear, core->stat.num_jeclear, NULL);
00459   sprintf(buf,"c%d.num_wp_jeclear",arch->id);
00460   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "number of branch mispredictions in the shadow of an earlier mispred", &core->stat.num_wp_jeclear, core->stat.num_wp_jeclear, NULL);
00461 
00462   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_occupancy",arch->id);
00463   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total RS occupancy", &core->stat.RS_occupancy, core->stat.RS_occupancy, NULL);
00464   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_empty",arch->id);
00465   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles RS was empty", &core->stat.RS_empty_cycles, core->stat.RS_empty_cycles, NULL);
00466   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_full",arch->id);
00467   stat_reg_counter(sdb, false, buf, "total cycles RS was full", &core->stat.RS_full_cycles, core->stat.RS_full_cycles, NULL);
00468   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_avg",arch->id);
00469   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.RS_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00470   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average RS occupancy", buf2, NULL);
00471   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_frac_empty",arch->id);
00472   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.RS_empty/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00473   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles RS was empty", buf2, NULL);
00474   sprintf(buf,"c%d.RS_frac_full",arch->id);
00475   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.RS_full/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00476   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles RS was full", buf2, NULL);
00477 
00478   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_occupancy",arch->id);
00479   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total LDQ occupancy", &core->stat.LDQ_occupancy, core->stat.LDQ_occupancy, NULL);
00480   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_empty",arch->id);
00481   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total cycles LDQ was empty", &core->stat.LDQ_empty_cycles, core->stat.LDQ_empty_cycles, NULL);
00482   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_full",arch->id);
00483   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total cycles LDQ was full", &core->stat.LDQ_full_cycles, core->stat.LDQ_full_cycles, NULL);
00484   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_avg",arch->id);
00485   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.LDQ_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00486   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average LDQ occupancy", buf2, NULL);
00487   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_frac_empty",arch->id);
00488   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.LDQ_empty/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00489   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles LDQ was empty", buf2, NULL);
00490   sprintf(buf,"c%d.LDQ_frac_full",arch->id);
00491   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.LDQ_full/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00492   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles LDQ was full", buf2, NULL);
00493 
00494   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_occupancy",arch->id);
00495   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total STQ occupancy", &core->stat.STQ_occupancy, core->stat.STQ_occupancy, NULL);
00496   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_empty",arch->id);
00497   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total cycles STQ was empty", &core->stat.STQ_empty_cycles, core->stat.STQ_empty_cycles, NULL);
00498   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_full",arch->id);
00499   stat_reg_counter(sdb, true, buf, "total cycles STQ was full", &core->stat.STQ_full_cycles, core->stat.STQ_full_cycles, NULL);
00500   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_avg",arch->id);
00501   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.STQ_occupancy/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00502   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "average STQ occupancy", buf2, NULL);
00503   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_frac_empty",arch->id);
00504   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.STQ_empty/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00505   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles STQ was empty", buf2, NULL);
00506   sprintf(buf,"c%d.STQ_frac_full",arch->id);
00507   sprintf(buf2,"c%d.STQ_full/c%d.sim_cycle",arch->id,arch->id);
00508   stat_reg_formula(sdb, true, buf, "fraction of cycles STQ was full", buf2, NULL);
00509 
00510   stat_reg_note(sdb,"\n#### DATA CACHE STATS ####");
00511   cache_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.DL1);
00512   cache_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.DTLB);
00513   if(core->memory.DL2)
00514   {
00515     cache_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.DL2);
00516     bus_reg_stats(sdb, core, core->memory.DL2_bus);
00517   }
00518 }
00519 
00520 void core_exec_STM_t::freeze_stats(void)
00521 {
00522 }
00523 
00524 void core_exec_STM_t::update_occupancy(void)
00525 {
00526     /* RS */
00527   core->stat.RS_occupancy += RS_num;
00528   if(RS_num >= core->knobs->exec.RS_size)
00529     core->stat.RS_full_cycles++;
00530   if(RS_num <= 0)
00531     core->stat.RS_empty_cycles++;
00532 
00533     /* LDQ */
00534   core->stat.LDQ_occupancy += LDQ_num;
00535   if(LDQ_num >= core->knobs->exec.LDQ_size)
00536     core->stat.LDQ_full_cycles++;
00537   if(LDQ_num <= 0)
00538     core->stat.LDQ_empty_cycles++;
00539 
00540     /* STQ */
00541   core->stat.STQ_occupancy += STQ_num;
00542   if(STQ_num >= core->knobs->exec.STQ_size)
00543     core->stat.STQ_full_cycles++;
00544   if(STQ_num <= 0)
00545     core->stat.STQ_empty_cycles++;
00546 }
00547 
00548 /* Functions to support dependency tracking 
00549    NOTE: "Ready" Queue is somewhat of a misnomer... uops are placed
00550    in the readyQ when all of their data-flow parents have issued.
00551    However, that doesn't necessarily mean that the corresponding
00552    inputs are "ready" due to non-unit execution latencies.  So it's
00553    really the Ready-And-Soon-To-Be-Ready-Queue... */
00554 core_exec_STM_t::readyQ_node_t * core_exec_STM_t::get_readyQ_node(void)
00555 {
00556   struct readyQ_node_t * p = NULL;
00557   if(readyQ_free_pool)
00558   {
00559     p = readyQ_free_pool;
00560     readyQ_free_pool = p->next;
00561   }
00562   else
00563   {
00564     p = (struct readyQ_node_t*) calloc(1,sizeof(*p));
00565     if(!p)
00566       fatal("couldn't calloc a readyQ node");
00567   }
00568   assert(p);
00569   p->next = NULL;
00570   p->when_assigned = sim_cycle;
00571 #ifdef DEBUG
00572   readyQ_free_pool_debt++;
00573 #endif
00574   return p;
00575 }
00576 
00577 void core_exec_STM_t::return_readyQ_node(struct readyQ_node_t * const p)
00578 {
00579   assert(p);
00580   assert(p->uop);
00581   p->next = readyQ_free_pool;
00582   readyQ_free_pool = p;
00583   p->uop = NULL;
00584   p->when_assigned = -1;
00585 #ifdef DEBUG
00586   readyQ_free_pool_debt--;
00587 #endif
00588 }
00589 
00590 /* Add the uop to the corresponding readyQ (based on port binding - we maintain
00591    one readyQ per execution port) */
00592 void core_exec_STM_t::insert_ready_uop(struct uop_t * const uop)
00593 {
00594   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00595   zesto_assert((uop->alloc.port_assignment >= 0) && (uop->alloc.port_assignment < knobs->exec.num_exec_ports),(void)0);
00596   zesto_assert(uop->timing.when_completed == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00597   zesto_assert(uop->timing.when_issued == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00598   zesto_assert(!uop->exec.in_readyQ,(void)0);
00599 
00600   struct readyQ_node_t ** RQ = &port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].readyQ;
00601   struct readyQ_node_t * new_node = get_readyQ_node();
00602   new_node->uop = uop;
00603   new_node->uop_seq = uop->decode.uop_seq;
00604   uop->exec.in_readyQ = true;
00605   uop->exec.action_id = core->new_action_id();
00606   new_node->action_id = uop->exec.action_id;
00607 
00608   if(!*RQ) /* empty ready queue */
00609   {
00610     *RQ = new_node;
00611     return;
00612   }
00613 
00614   struct readyQ_node_t * current = *RQ, * prev = NULL;
00615 
00616   /* insert in age order: first find insertion point */
00617   while(current && (current->uop_seq < uop->decode.uop_seq))
00618   {
00619     prev = current;
00620     current = current->next;
00621   }
00622 
00623   if(!prev) /* uop is oldest */
00624   {
00625     new_node->next = *RQ;
00626     *RQ = new_node;
00627   }
00628   else
00629   {
00630     new_node->next = current;
00631     prev->next = new_node;
00632   }
00633 }
00634 
00635 /*****************************/
00636 /* MAIN SCHED/EXEC FUNCTIONS */
00637 /*****************************/
00638 
00639 void core_exec_STM_t::RS_schedule(void) /* for uops in the RS */
00640 {
00641   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00642   int i;
00643 
00644   /* select/pick from ready instructions and send to exec ports */
00645   for(i=0;i<knobs->exec.num_exec_ports;i++)
00646   {
00647     struct readyQ_node_t * rq = port[i].readyQ;
00648     struct readyQ_node_t * prev = NULL;
00649     int issued = false;
00650 
00651     if(rq && rq->uop->timing.when_ready > sim_cycle)
00652       continue; /* nothing ready on this port */
00653 
00654     while(rq) /* if anyone's waiting to issue to this port */
00655     {
00656       struct uop_t * uop = rq->uop;
00657       enum md_fu_class FU_class = uop->decode.FU_class;
00658 
00659       if(uop->exec.action_id != rq->action_id) /* RQ entry has been squashed */
00660       {
00661         struct readyQ_node_t * next = rq->next;
00662         /* remove from readyQ */
00663         if(prev)
00664           prev->next = next;
00665         else
00666           port[i].readyQ = next;
00667         return_readyQ_node(rq);
00668         /* and go on to next node */
00669         rq = next;
00670       }
00671       else if((uop->timing.when_ready <= sim_cycle) &&
00672               !issued &&
00673               (port[i].FU[FU_class]->when_executable <= sim_cycle) &&
00674               (port[i].FU[FU_class]->occupancy < port[i].FU[FU_class]->latency))
00675       {
00676         int insert_position = port[i].FU[FU_class]->occupancy+1;
00677         zesto_assert(uop->alloc.port_assignment == i,(void)0);
00678 
00679         uop->timing.when_issued = sim_cycle;
00680         port[i].FU[FU_class]->pipe[insert_position].uop = uop;
00681         port[i].FU[FU_class]->pipe[insert_position].action_id = uop->exec.action_id;
00682         port[i].FU[FU_class]->pipe[insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle + port[i].FU[FU_class]->latency;
00683         ALU_heap_balance(port[i].FU[FU_class]->pipe,insert_position);
00684 
00685         port[i].FU[FU_class]->occupancy++;
00686         port[i].FU[FU_class]->when_executable = sim_cycle + port[i].FU[FU_class]->issue_rate;
00687         check_for_work = true;
00688 
00689         struct readyQ_node_t * next = rq->next;
00690         /* remove from readyQ */
00691         if(prev)
00692           prev->next = next;
00693         else
00694           port[i].readyQ = next;
00695         return_readyQ_node(rq);
00696         uop->exec.in_readyQ = false;
00697         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.exec_uops_issued++;)
00698 
00699         /* only one uop schedules from an issue port per cycle */
00700         issued = true;
00701         rq = next;
00702       }
00703       else
00704       {
00705         /* node valid, but not ready; skip over it */
00706         prev = rq;
00707         rq = rq->next;
00708       }
00709     }
00710   }
00711 }
00712 
00713 /* returns true if load is allowed to issue (or is predicted to be ok) */
00714 bool core_exec_STM_t::check_load_issue_conditions(const struct uop_t * const uop)
00715 {
00716   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00717   /* are all previous STA's known? If there's a match, is the STD ready? */
00718   bool regular_match = false;
00719   int i;
00720   int match_index = -1;
00721   int num_stores = 0; /* need this extra condition because STQ could be full with all stores older than the load we're considering */
00722 
00723   /* don't reissue someone who's already issued */
00724   zesto_assert((uop->alloc.LDQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.LDQ_index < knobs->exec.LDQ_size),false);
00725   /* assume you've already checked this before calling check_load_issue_conditions */
00726   md_addr_t ld_addr = LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].uop->oracle.virt_addr;
00727 
00728   for(i=LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].store_color;
00729       ((modinc(i,knobs->exec.STQ_size)) != STQ_head) && (STQ[i].uop_seq < uop->decode.uop_seq) && (num_stores < STQ_num);
00730       i=moddec(i,knobs->exec.STQ_size) )
00731   {
00732     /* check addr match */
00733     int st_mem_size = STQ[i].mem_size;
00734     int ld_mem_size = uop->decode.mem_size;
00735     md_addr_t st_addr;
00736     
00737     if(STQ[i].addr_valid)
00738       st_addr = STQ[i].virt_addr; /* addr of first byte */
00739     else
00740     {
00741       zesto_assert(STQ[i].sta,false);
00742       return false; /* store-addr unknown */
00743     }
00744 
00745     zesto_assert(st_mem_size,false);
00746     zesto_assert(ld_mem_size,false);
00747     zesto_assert(uop->Mop->oracle.spec_mode || ld_addr,false);
00748     zesto_assert(st_addr || (STQ[i].sta && STQ[i].sta->Mop->oracle.spec_mode),false);
00749 
00750     if(st_addr == ld_addr) /* address match */
00751     {
00752       if((match_index == -1) && (STQ[i].addr_valid))
00753       {
00754         match_index = i;
00755         regular_match = true;
00756         if(!STQ[i].value_valid)
00757           return false; /* store-data unknown */
00758       }
00759     }
00760     else
00761     {
00762       /* no conflict here (or unhandled partial match) */
00763     }
00764     num_stores++;
00765   }
00766 
00767   /* no sta/std unknowns and no partial matches: good to go! */
00768   return true;
00769 }
00770 
00771 /* The callback functions below (after load_writeback) mark flags
00772    in the uop to specify the completion of each task, and only when
00773    both are done do we call the load-writeback function to finish
00774    off execution of the load. */
00775 
00776 void core_exec_STM_t::load_writeback(struct uop_t * const uop)
00777 {
00778   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00779   zesto_assert((uop->alloc.LDQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.LDQ_index < knobs->exec.LDQ_size),(void)0);
00780   if(!LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].hit_in_STQ) /* no match in STQ, so use cache value */
00781   {
00782     uop->exec.ovalue = uop->oracle.ovalue; /* XXX: just using oracle value for now */
00783     uop->exec.ovalue_valid = true;
00784     zesto_assert(uop->timing.when_completed == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00785     uop->timing.when_completed = sim_cycle;
00786     last_completed = sim_cycle; /* for deadlock detection */
00787     if(uop->decode.is_ctrl && (uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC != uop->Mop->fetch.pred_NPC)) /* XXX: for RETN */
00788     {
00789       core->oracle->pipe_recover(uop->Mop,uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC);
00790       ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_jeclear++;)
00791       if(uop->Mop->oracle.spec_mode)
00792         ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_wp_jeclear++;)
00793     }
00794 
00795     uop->timing.when_otag_ready = sim_cycle;
00796 
00797     /* bypass output value to dependents; wake them up if appropriate. */
00798     struct odep_t * odep = uop->exec.odep_uop;
00799 
00800     while(odep)
00801     {
00802       tick_t when_ready = 0;
00803 
00804       zesto_assert(!odep->uop->exec.ivalue_valid[odep->op_num],(void)0);
00805       odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[odep->op_num] = sim_cycle;
00806 
00807       for(int j=0;j<MAX_IDEPS;j++)
00808         if(when_ready < odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j])
00809           when_ready = odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j];
00810 
00811       if(when_ready < TICK_T_MAX)
00812       {
00813         odep->uop->timing.when_ready = when_ready;
00814         zesto_assert(!odep->uop->exec.in_readyQ,(void)0);
00815         insert_ready_uop(odep->uop);
00816       }
00817 
00818       odep->uop->exec.ivalue_valid[odep->op_num] = true;
00819       if(odep->aflags) /* shouldn't happen for loads? */
00820       {
00821         warn("load modified flags?\n");
00822         odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num].dw = uop->exec.oflags;
00823       }
00824       else
00825         odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num] = uop->exec.ovalue;
00826 
00827       odep = odep->next;
00828     }
00829   }
00830 }
00831 
00832 void core_exec_STM_t::DL1_callback(void * const op)
00833 {
00834   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t*) op;
00835 #ifndef DEBUG
00836   struct core_t * const core = uop->core; // for use with zesto-assert
00837 #endif
00838   class core_exec_STM_t * E = (core_exec_STM_t*)uop->core->exec;
00839   if(uop->alloc.LDQ_index != -1)
00840   {
00841     zesto_assert(uop->exec.when_data_loaded == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00842     uop->exec.when_data_loaded = sim_cycle;
00843     if((uop->exec.when_data_loaded <= sim_cycle) &&
00844        (uop->exec.when_addr_translated <= sim_cycle) &&
00845         !E->LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].hit_in_STQ) /* no match in STQ, so use cache value */
00846     {
00847       /* if load received value from STQ, it could have already
00848          committed by the time this gets called (esp. if we went to
00849          main memory) */
00850       E->load_writeback(uop);
00851     }
00852   }
00853 }
00854 
00855 void core_exec_STM_t::DTLB_callback(void * const op)
00856 {
00857   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t*) op;
00858 #ifndef DEBUG
00859   struct core_t * const core = uop->core; // for use with zesto-assert
00860 #endif
00861   struct core_exec_STM_t * const E = (core_exec_STM_t*)uop->core->exec;
00862   if(uop->alloc.LDQ_index != -1)
00863   {
00864     zesto_assert(uop->exec.when_addr_translated == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00865     uop->exec.when_addr_translated = sim_cycle;
00866     if((uop->exec.when_data_loaded <= sim_cycle) &&
00867        (uop->exec.when_addr_translated <= sim_cycle) &&
00868         !E->LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].hit_in_STQ)
00869       E->load_writeback(uop);
00870   }
00871 }
00872 
00873 /* returns true if TLB translation has completed */
00874 bool core_exec_STM_t::translated_callback(void * const op, const seq_t action_id)
00875 {
00876   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t*) op;
00877   if((uop->exec.action_id == action_id) && (uop->alloc.LDQ_index != -1))
00878     return uop->exec.when_addr_translated <= sim_cycle;
00879   else
00880     return true;
00881 }
00882 
00883 /* Used by the cache processing functions to recover the id of the
00884    uop without needing to know about the uop struct. */
00885 seq_t core_exec_STM_t::get_uop_action_id(void * const op)
00886 {
00887   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t*) op;
00888   return uop->exec.action_id;
00889 }
00890 
00891 /* process loads exiting the STQ search pipeline, update caches */
00892 void core_exec_STM_t::LDST_exec(void)
00893 {
00894   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
00895   int i;
00896 
00897   /* process STQ pipes */
00898   for(i=0;i<knobs->exec.port_binding[FU_LD].num_FUs;i++)
00899   {
00900     int port_num = knobs->exec.port_binding[FU_LD].ports[i];
00901     int j;
00902 
00903     if( (port[port_num].STQ->occupancy > 0) &&
00904         (port[port_num].STQ->pipe[1].pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle))
00905     {
00906       struct uop_t * uop = port[port_num].STQ->pipe[1].uop; // heap root
00907       zesto_assert(uop != NULL,(void)0);
00908       if(port[port_num].STQ->pipe[1].action_id == uop->exec.action_id)
00909       {
00910         int num_stores = 0;
00911         zesto_assert((uop->alloc.LDQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.LDQ_index < knobs->exec.LDQ_size),(void)0);
00912 
00913         j=LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].store_color;
00914 
00915         int cond1 = STQ[j].sta != NULL;
00916         seq_t seq1 = (seq_t)-1, seq2 = (seq_t)-1;
00917         zesto_assert(j >= 0,(void)0);
00918         zesto_assert(j < knobs->exec.STQ_size,(void)0);
00919         if(j)
00920         {
00921           seq1 = (seq_t)-2;
00922         }
00923         if(cond1)
00924         {
00925           seq1 = STQ[j].sta->decode.uop_seq;
00926           seq2 = uop->decode.uop_seq;
00927         }
00928         int cond2 = cond1 && (seq1 < seq2);
00929         int cond3 = (num_stores < STQ_num);
00930 
00931         while(cond1 && cond2 && cond3)
00932         {
00933           md_addr_t st_addr = STQ[j].virt_addr;
00934           md_addr_t ld_addr = LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].virt_addr;
00935 
00936           if(STQ[j].addr_valid)
00937           {
00938             if(st_addr == ld_addr) /* match */
00939             {
00940               zesto_assert(uop->timing.when_completed == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
00941               if(STQ[j].value_valid)
00942               {
00943                 uop->exec.ovalue = STQ[j].value;
00944                 uop->exec.ovalue_valid = true;
00945                 uop->timing.when_completed = sim_cycle;
00946                 last_completed = sim_cycle; /* for deadlock detection */
00947                 LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].hit_in_STQ = true;
00948 
00949                 if(uop->decode.is_ctrl && (uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC != uop->Mop->fetch.pred_NPC)) /* for RETN */
00950                 {
00951                   core->oracle->pipe_recover(uop->Mop,uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC);
00952                   ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_jeclear++;)
00953                   if(uop->Mop->oracle.spec_mode)
00954                     ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_wp_jeclear++;)
00955                 }
00956 
00957                 uop->timing.when_otag_ready = sim_cycle;
00958 
00959                 struct odep_t * odep = uop->exec.odep_uop;
00960 
00961                 while(odep)
00962                 {
00963                   tick_t when_ready = 0;
00964 
00965                   odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[odep->op_num] = sim_cycle;
00966 
00967                   for(int j=0;j<MAX_IDEPS;j++)
00968                     if(when_ready < odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j])
00969                       when_ready = odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j];
00970 
00971                   if(when_ready < TICK_T_MAX)
00972                   {
00973                     odep->uop->timing.when_ready = when_ready;
00974                     if(!odep->uop->exec.in_readyQ)
00975                       insert_ready_uop(odep->uop);
00976                   }
00977 
00978                   /* bypass output value to dependents */
00979                   odep->uop->exec.ivalue_valid[odep->op_num] = true;
00980                   if(odep->aflags) /* shouldn't happen for loads? */
00981                   {
00982                     warn("load modified flags?");
00983                     odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num].dw = uop->exec.oflags;
00984                   }
00985                   else
00986                     odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num] = uop->exec.ovalue;
00987 
00988                   odep = odep->next;
00989                 }
00990               }
00991               else /* addr match but STD unknown */
00992               {
00993                 /* When_issued is still set, so LDQ won't reschedule the load.  The load
00994                    will wait until the STD finishes and wakes it up. */
00995                 uop->exec.action_id = core->new_action_id();
00996               }
00997               break;
00998             }
00999             else /* no match */
01000             {
01001               /* nothing to do */
01002             }
01003           }
01004 
01005           num_stores++;
01006 
01007           j=moddec(j,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(j-1+knobs->exec.STQ_size) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01008 
01009           cond1 = STQ[j].sta != NULL;
01010           cond2 = cond1 && (STQ[j].sta->decode.uop_seq < uop->decode.uop_seq);
01011           cond3 = (num_stores < STQ_num);
01012         }
01013       }
01014 
01015       ALU_heap_remove(port[port_num].STQ->pipe,port[port_num].STQ->occupancy);
01016       port[port_num].STQ->occupancy--;
01017       zesto_assert(port[port_num].STQ->occupancy >= 0,(void)0);
01018     }
01019   }
01020 
01021   if(core->memory.DTLB->check_for_work) cache_process(core->memory.DTLB);
01022   //if((core->current_thread->id == 0) && !(sim_cycle&core->uncore->LLC_cycle_mask) && core->uncore->LLC->check_for_work)
01023     //cache_process(uncore->LLC);
01024   if(core->memory.DL2 && core->memory.DL2->check_for_work) cache_process(core->memory.DL2);
01025   if(core->memory.DL1->check_for_work) cache_process(core->memory.DL1);
01026 }
01027 
01028 /* Schedule load uops to execute from the LDQ.  Load execution occurs in a two-step
01029    process: first the address gets computed (issuing from the RS), and then the
01030    cache/STQ search occur (issuing from the LDQ). */
01031 void core_exec_STM_t::LDQ_schedule(void)
01032 {
01033   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01034   int i;
01035   int index = LDQ_head;
01036   /* walk LDQ, if anyone's ready, issue to DTLB/DL1 */
01037   for(i=0;i<LDQ_num;i++)
01038   {
01039     //int index = (LDQ_head + i) % knobs->exec.LDQ_size; // incremented at bottom of loop
01040     if(LDQ[index].addr_valid) /* agen has finished */
01041     {
01042       if(LDQ[index].when_issued == TICK_T_MAX) /* load hasn't issued to DL1/STQ already */
01043       {
01044         if(check_load_issue_conditions(LDQ[index].uop)) /* retval of true means load is predicted to be cleared for issue */
01045         {
01046           struct uop_t * uop = LDQ[index].uop;
01047           if((cache_enqueuable(core->memory.DTLB,core->current_thread->id,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr))) &&
01048              (cache_enqueuable(core->memory.DL1,core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr)) &&
01049              (port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->occupancy < port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->latency))
01050           {
01051             uop->exec.when_data_loaded = TICK_T_MAX;
01052             uop->exec.when_addr_translated = TICK_T_MAX;
01053             cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.DTLB,NULL,CACHE_READ,core->current_thread->id,uop->Mop->fetch.PC,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr),uop->exec.action_id,0,NO_MSHR,uop,DTLB_callback,NULL,NULL,get_uop_action_id);
01054             cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.DL1,NULL,CACHE_READ,core->current_thread->id,uop->Mop->fetch.PC,uop->oracle.virt_addr,uop->exec.action_id,0,NO_MSHR,uop,DL1_callback,NULL,translated_callback,get_uop_action_id);
01055 
01056             int insert_position = port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->occupancy+1;
01057             port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->pipe[insert_position].uop = uop;
01058             port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->pipe[insert_position].action_id = uop->exec.action_id;
01059             port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->pipe[insert_position].pipe_exit_time = sim_cycle + port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->latency;
01060             ALU_heap_balance(port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->pipe,insert_position);
01061             port[uop->alloc.port_assignment].STQ->occupancy++;
01062             LDQ[index].when_issued = sim_cycle;
01063           }
01064         }
01065         else
01066         {
01067           LDQ[index].uop->timing.when_otag_ready = TICK_T_MAX;
01068           LDQ[index].uop->timing.when_completed = TICK_T_MAX;
01069           LDQ[index].hit_in_STQ = false;
01070         }
01071       }
01072     }
01073     index = modinc(index,knobs->exec.LDQ_size);
01074   }
01075 }
01076 
01077 /* Process execution (in ALUs) of uops */
01078 void core_exec_STM_t::ALU_exec(void)
01079 {
01080   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01081   int i;
01082 
01083   if(check_for_work == false)
01084     return;
01085 
01086   bool work_found = false;
01087 
01088   /* Process Functional Units */
01089   for(i=0;i<knobs->exec.num_exec_ports;i++)
01090   {
01091     int j;
01092     for(j=0;j<port[i].num_FU_types;j++)
01093     {
01094       enum md_fu_class FU_type = port[i].FU_types[j];
01095       struct ALU_t * FU = port[i].FU[FU_type];
01096       if(FU && (FU->occupancy > 0))
01097       {
01098         work_found = true;
01099         /* process last stage of FU pipeline (those uops completing execution) */
01100         if(FU->pipe[1].pipe_exit_time <= sim_cycle) // heap root
01101         {
01102           struct uop_t * uop = FU->pipe[1].uop;
01103           zesto_assert(uop != NULL,(void)0);
01104 
01105           int squashed = (FU->pipe[1].action_id != uop->exec.action_id);
01106           ALU_heap_remove(FU->pipe,FU->occupancy);
01107 
01108           FU->occupancy--;
01109           zesto_assert(FU->occupancy >= 0,(void)0);
01110 
01111           /* there's a uop completing execution (that hasn't been squashed) */
01112           if(!squashed)
01113           {
01114             if(uop->decode.is_load) /* loads need to be processed differently */
01115             {
01116               /* update load queue entry */
01117               zesto_assert((uop->alloc.LDQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.LDQ_index < knobs->exec.LDQ_size),(void)0);
01118               LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].virt_addr = uop->oracle.virt_addr;
01119               LDQ[uop->alloc.LDQ_index].addr_valid = true;
01120               /* actual scheduling from load queue takes place in LDQ_schedule() */
01121             }
01122             else
01123             {
01124               /* XXX for now just copy oracle value */
01125               uop->exec.ovalue_valid = true;
01126               uop->exec.ovalue = uop->oracle.ovalue;
01127 
01128               /* alloc, uopQ, and decode all have to search for the
01129                  recovery point (Mop) because a long flow may have
01130                  uops that span multiple sections of the pipeline.  */
01131               if(uop->decode.is_ctrl && (uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC != uop->Mop->fetch.pred_NPC))
01132               {
01133                 /* XXX: should compute */
01134                 core->oracle->pipe_recover(uop->Mop,uop->Mop->oracle.NextPC);
01135                 ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_jeclear++;)
01136                 if(uop->Mop->oracle.spec_mode)
01137                   ZESTO_STAT(core->stat.num_wp_jeclear++;)
01138               }
01139               else if(uop->decode.is_sta)
01140               {
01141                 zesto_assert((uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01142                 zesto_assert(!STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].addr_valid,(void)0);
01143                 STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].virt_addr = uop->oracle.virt_addr;
01144                 STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].addr_valid = true;
01145               }
01146               else if(uop->decode.is_std)
01147               {
01148                 zesto_assert((uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01149                 zesto_assert(!STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].value_valid,(void)0);
01150                 STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].value = uop->exec.ovalue;
01151                 STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].value_valid = true;
01152               }
01153 
01154               if((uop->decode.is_sta || uop->decode.is_std) &&
01155                   STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].addr_valid &&
01156                   STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].value_valid)
01157               {
01158                 /* both parts of store have now made it to the STQ: walk
01159                    forward in LDQ to see if there are any loads waiting on this
01160                    this STD.  If so, unblock them. */
01161                 int idx;
01162                 int num_loads = 0;
01163                 int overwrite_index = uop->alloc.STQ_index;
01164 
01165                 /* XXX using oracle info here. */
01166                 zesto_assert((uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01167                 md_addr_t st_addr = STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].sta->oracle.virt_addr;
01168 
01169                 for(idx=STQ[uop->alloc.STQ_index].next_load;
01170                     LDQ[idx].uop && (LDQ[idx].uop->decode.uop_seq > uop->decode.uop_seq) && (num_loads < LDQ_num);
01171                     idx=modinc(idx,knobs->exec.LDQ_size))
01172                 {
01173                   if(LDQ[idx].store_color != uop->alloc.STQ_index) /* some younger stores present */
01174                   {
01175                     bool overwritten = false;
01176                     /* scan store queue for younger loads to see if we've been overwritten */
01177                     while(overwrite_index != LDQ[idx].store_color)
01178                     {
01179                       overwrite_index = modinc(overwrite_index,knobs->exec.STQ_size);
01180                       if(overwrite_index == STQ_tail)
01181                         zesto_fatal("searching for matching store color but hit the end of the STQ",(void)0);
01182 
01183                       md_addr_t new_st_addr = STQ[overwrite_index].virt_addr;
01184 
01185                       /* does this store overwrite any of our bytes? 
01186                          does not properly handle partial forwarding cases */
01187                       if(STQ[overwrite_index].addr_valid && (st_addr == new_st_addr))
01188                       {
01189                         overwritten = true;
01190                         break; /* while */
01191                       }
01192                     }
01193 
01194                     if(overwritten)
01195                       break; /* for */
01196                   }
01197 
01198                   if(LDQ[idx].addr_valid && /* if addr not valid, load hasn't finished AGEN... it'll pick up the right value after AGEN */
01199                      (LDQ[idx].when_issued != TICK_T_MAX)) /* similar to addr not valid, the load'll grab the value when it issues from the LDQ */
01200                   {
01201                     md_addr_t ld_addr = LDQ[idx].virt_addr;
01202 
01203                     if(st_addr == ld_addr)
01204                     {
01205                       /* possible that the load already executed due to imprecise
01206                          tracking of partial forwarding, multiple stores to the
01207                          same address, etc. */
01208                       if(LDQ[idx].uop->timing.when_completed == TICK_T_MAX)
01209                       {
01210                         /* mark load as schedulable */
01211                         LDQ[idx].when_issued = TICK_T_MAX; /* this will allow it to get issued from LDQ_schedule */
01212                         LDQ[idx].hit_in_STQ = false; /* it's possible the store commits before the load gets back to searching the STQ */
01213 
01214                         /* invalidate any in-flight loads from cache hierarchy */
01215                         LDQ[idx].uop->exec.action_id = core->new_action_id();
01216                       }
01217                     }
01218                   }
01219 
01220                   num_loads++;
01221                 }
01222               }
01223 
01224               zesto_assert(uop->timing.when_completed == TICK_T_MAX,(void)0);
01225               uop->timing.when_completed = sim_cycle;
01226               last_completed = sim_cycle; /* for deadlock detection */
01227 
01228               /* bypass output value to dependents */
01229               struct odep_t * odep = uop->exec.odep_uop;
01230               while(odep)
01231               {
01232                 tick_t when_ready = 0;
01233 
01234                 odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[odep->op_num] = sim_cycle;
01235 
01236                 for(int j=0;j<MAX_IDEPS;j++)
01237                   if(when_ready < odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j])
01238                     when_ready = odep->uop->timing.when_ival_ready[j];
01239 
01240                 if(when_ready < TICK_T_MAX)
01241                 {
01242                   odep->uop->timing.when_ready = when_ready;
01243                   if(!odep->uop->exec.in_readyQ)
01244                     insert_ready_uop(odep->uop);
01245                 }
01246 
01247                 zesto_assert(!odep->uop->exec.ivalue_valid[odep->op_num],(void)0);
01248                 odep->uop->exec.ivalue_valid[odep->op_num] = true;
01249                 if(odep->aflags)
01250                   odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num].dw = uop->exec.oflags;
01251                 else
01252                   odep->uop->exec.ivalue[odep->op_num] = uop->exec.ovalue;
01253 
01254                 odep = odep->next;
01255               }
01256             }
01257 
01258             /* deallocate the RS entry */
01259             core->exec->RS_deallocate(uop);
01260             /* update port loading table */
01261             core->alloc->RS_deallocate(uop);
01262           }
01263         }
01264       }
01265     }
01266   }
01267 
01268   check_for_work = work_found;
01269 }
01270 
01271 void core_exec_STM_t::recover(const struct Mop_t * const Mop)
01272 {
01273   /* most flushing/squashing is accomplished through assignments of new action_id's */
01274 }
01275 
01276 void core_exec_STM_t::recover(void)
01277 {
01278   /* most flushing/squashing is accomplished through assignments of new action_id's */
01279 }
01280 
01281 bool core_exec_STM_t::RS_available(void)
01282 {
01283   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01284   return RS_num < knobs->exec.RS_size;
01285 }
01286 
01287 /* assumes you already called RS_available to check that
01288    an entry is available */
01289 void core_exec_STM_t::RS_insert(struct uop_t * const uop)
01290 {
01291   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01292   int RS_index;
01293   /* find a free RS entry */
01294   for(RS_index=0;RS_index < knobs->exec.RS_size;RS_index++)
01295   {
01296     if(RS[RS_index] == NULL)
01297       break;
01298   }
01299   if(RS_index == knobs->exec.RS_size)
01300     zesto_fatal("RS and RS_num out of sync",(void)0);
01301 
01302   RS[RS_index] = uop;
01303   RS_num++;
01304   uop->alloc.RS_index = RS_index;
01305 }
01306 
01307 /* add uops to an existing entry (where all uops in the same
01308    entry are assumed to be fused) */
01309 void core_exec_STM_t::RS_fuse_insert(struct uop_t * const uop)
01310 {
01311   fatal("fusion not supported in STM exec module");
01312 }
01313 
01314 void core_exec_STM_t::RS_deallocate(struct uop_t * const dead_uop)
01315 {
01316   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01317   zesto_assert(dead_uop->alloc.RS_index < knobs->exec.RS_size,(void)0);
01318 
01319   RS[dead_uop->alloc.RS_index] = NULL;
01320   RS_num --;
01321   zesto_assert(RS_num >= 0,(void)0);
01322   dead_uop->alloc.RS_index = -1;
01323 }
01324 
01325 bool core_exec_STM_t::LDQ_available(void)
01326 {
01327   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01328   return LDQ_num < knobs->exec.LDQ_size;
01329 }
01330 
01331 void core_exec_STM_t::LDQ_insert(struct uop_t * const uop)
01332 {
01333   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01334   //memset(&LDQ[LDQ_tail],0,sizeof(*LDQ));
01335   memzero(&LDQ[LDQ_tail],sizeof(*LDQ));
01336   LDQ[LDQ_tail].uop = uop;
01337   LDQ[LDQ_tail].mem_size = uop->decode.mem_size;
01338   LDQ[LDQ_tail].store_color = moddec(STQ_tail,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(STQ_tail - 1 + knobs->exec.STQ_size) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01339   LDQ[LDQ_tail].when_issued = TICK_T_MAX;
01340   uop->alloc.LDQ_index = LDQ_tail;
01341   LDQ_num++;
01342   LDQ_tail = modinc(LDQ_tail,knobs->exec.LDQ_size); //(LDQ_tail+1) % knobs->exec.LDQ_size;
01343 }
01344 
01345 /* called by commit */
01346 void core_exec_STM_t::LDQ_deallocate(struct uop_t * const uop)
01347 {
01348   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01349   LDQ[LDQ_head].uop = NULL;
01350   LDQ_num --;
01351   LDQ_head = modinc(LDQ_head,knobs->exec.LDQ_size); //(LDQ_head+1) % knobs->exec.LDQ_size;
01352   uop->alloc.LDQ_index = -1;
01353 }
01354 
01355 void core_exec_STM_t::LDQ_squash(struct uop_t * const dead_uop)
01356 {
01357   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01358   zesto_assert((dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index >= 0) && (dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index < knobs->exec.LDQ_size),(void)0);
01359   zesto_assert(LDQ[dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index].uop == dead_uop,(void)0);
01360   //memset(&LDQ[dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index],0,sizeof(LDQ[0]));
01361   memzero(&LDQ[dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index],sizeof(LDQ[0]));
01362   LDQ_num --;
01363   LDQ_tail = moddec(LDQ_tail,knobs->exec.LDQ_size); //(LDQ_tail - 1 + knobs->exec.LDQ_size) % knobs->exec.LDQ_size;
01364   zesto_assert(LDQ_num >= 0,(void)0);
01365   dead_uop->alloc.LDQ_index = -1;
01366 }
01367 
01368 bool core_exec_STM_t::STQ_available(void)
01369 {
01370   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01371   return STQ_num < knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01372 }
01373 
01374 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_insert_sta(struct uop_t * const uop)
01375 {
01376   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01377   //memset(&STQ[STQ_tail],0,sizeof(*STQ));
01378   memzero(&STQ[STQ_tail],sizeof(*STQ));
01379   STQ[STQ_tail].sta = uop;
01380   if(STQ[STQ_tail].sta != NULL)
01381     uop->decode.is_sta = true;
01382   STQ[STQ_tail].mem_size = uop->decode.mem_size;
01383   STQ[STQ_tail].uop_seq = uop->decode.uop_seq;
01384   STQ[STQ_tail].next_load = LDQ_tail;
01385   uop->alloc.STQ_index = STQ_tail;
01386   STQ_num++;
01387   STQ_tail = modinc(STQ_tail,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(STQ_tail+1) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01388 }
01389 
01390 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_insert_std(struct uop_t * const uop)
01391 {
01392   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01393   /* STQ_tail already incremented from the STA.  Just add this uop to STQ->std */
01394   int index = moddec(STQ_tail,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(STQ_tail - 1 + knobs->exec.STQ_size) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01395   uop->alloc.STQ_index = index;
01396   STQ[index].std = uop;
01397   zesto_assert(STQ[index].sta,(void)0); /* shouldn't have STD w/o a corresponding STA */
01398   zesto_assert(STQ[index].sta->Mop == uop->Mop,(void)0); /* and we should be from the same macro */
01399 }
01400 
01401 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_deallocate_sta(void)
01402 {
01403   STQ[STQ_head].sta = NULL;
01404 }
01405 
01406 /* returns true if successful */
01407 bool core_exec_STM_t::STQ_deallocate_std(struct uop_t * const uop)
01408 {
01409   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01410   /* Store write back occurs here at commit. */
01411   if(!cache_enqueuable(core->memory.DL1,core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr) ||
01412      !cache_enqueuable(core->memory.DTLB,core->current_thread->id,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr)))
01413     return false;
01414 
01415   /* These are just dummy placeholders, but we need them
01416      because the original uop pointers will be made invalid
01417      when the Mop commits and the oracle reclaims the
01418      original uop-arrays.  The store continues to occupy STQ
01419      entries until the store actually finishes accessing
01420      memory, but commit can proceed past this store once the
01421      request has entered into the cache hierarchy. */
01422   struct uop_t * dl1_uop = core->get_uop_array(1);
01423   struct uop_t * dtlb_uop = core->get_uop_array(1);
01424   dl1_uop->core = core;
01425   dtlb_uop->core = core;
01426 
01427   dl1_uop->alloc.STQ_index = uop->alloc.STQ_index;
01428   dtlb_uop->alloc.STQ_index = uop->alloc.STQ_index;
01429 
01430   STQ[STQ_head].action_id = core->new_action_id();
01431   dl1_uop->exec.action_id = STQ[STQ_head].action_id;
01432   dtlb_uop->exec.action_id = dl1_uop->exec.action_id;
01433 
01434   cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.DTLB,NULL,CACHE_READ,core->current_thread->id,uop->Mop->fetch.PC,PAGE_TABLE_ADDR(core->current_thread->id,uop->oracle.virt_addr),dtlb_uop->exec.action_id,0,NO_MSHR,dtlb_uop,store_dtlb_callback,NULL,NULL,get_uop_action_id);
01435   cache_enqueue(core,core->memory.DL1,NULL,CACHE_WRITE,core->current_thread->id,uop->Mop->fetch.PC,uop->oracle.virt_addr,dl1_uop->exec.action_id,0,NO_MSHR,dl1_uop,store_dl1_callback,NULL,store_translated_callback,get_uop_action_id);
01436 
01437   STQ[STQ_head].std = NULL;
01438   STQ[STQ_head].translation_complete = false;
01439   STQ[STQ_head].write_complete = false;
01440   STQ_num --;
01441   STQ_head = modinc(STQ_head,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(STQ_head+1) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01442 
01443   return true;
01444 }
01445 
01446 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_deallocate_senior(void)
01447 {
01448   fatal("Senior STQ not supported in STM exec module");
01449 }
01450 
01451 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_squash_sta(struct uop_t * const dead_uop)
01452 {
01453   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01454   zesto_assert((dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01455   zesto_assert(STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index].std == NULL,(void)0);
01456   zesto_assert(STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index].sta == dead_uop,(void)0);
01457   //memset(&STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index],0,sizeof(STQ[0]));
01458   memzero(&STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index],sizeof(STQ[0]));
01459   STQ_num --;
01460   STQ_tail = moddec(STQ_tail,knobs->exec.STQ_size); //(STQ_tail - 1 + knobs->exec.STQ_size) % knobs->exec.STQ_size;
01461   zesto_assert(STQ_num >= 0,(void)0);
01462   dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index = -1;
01463 }
01464 
01465 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_squash_std(struct uop_t * const dead_uop)
01466 {
01467   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01468   zesto_assert((dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01469   zesto_assert(STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index].std == dead_uop,(void)0);
01470   STQ[dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index].std = NULL;
01471   dead_uop->alloc.STQ_index = -1;
01472 }
01473 
01474 void core_exec_STM_t::STQ_squash_senior(void)
01475 {
01476   fatal("Senior STQ not supported in STM exec module");
01477 }
01478 
01479 void core_exec_STM_t::recover_check_assertions(void)
01480 {
01481   zesto_assert(STQ_num == 0,(void)0);
01482   zesto_assert(LDQ_num == 0,(void)0);
01483 }
01484 
01485 /* Stores don't write back to cache/memory until commit.  When D$
01486    and DTLB accesses complete, these functions get called which
01487    update the status of the corresponding STQ entries.  The STQ
01488    entry cannot be deallocated until the store has completed. */
01489 void core_exec_STM_t::store_dl1_callback(void * const op)
01490 {
01491   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t *)op;
01492   struct core_t * const core = uop->core;
01493   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01494 
01495   zesto_assert((uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01496   core->return_uop_array(uop);
01497 }
01498 
01499 void core_exec_STM_t::store_dtlb_callback(void * const op)
01500 {
01501   struct uop_t * const uop = (struct uop_t *)op;
01502   struct core_t * const core = uop->core;
01503   struct core_knobs_t * knobs = core->knobs;
01504 
01505   zesto_assert((uop->alloc.STQ_index >= 0) && (uop->alloc.STQ_index < knobs->exec.STQ_size),(void)0);
01506   core->return_uop_array(uop);
01507 }
01508 
01509 bool core_exec_STM_t::store_translated_callback(void * const op, const seq_t action_id /* ignored */)
01510 {
01511   return true;
01512 }
01513 
01514 /* input state: assumes that the new node has just been inserted at
01515    insert_position and all remaining nodes obey the heap property */
01516 void core_exec_STM_t::ALU_heap_balance(struct uop_action_t * const pipe, const int insert_position)
01517 {
01518   int pos = insert_position;
01519   while(pos > 1)
01520   {
01521     int parent = pos >> 1;
01522     if(pipe[parent].pipe_exit_time > pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time)
01523     {
01524       memswap(&pipe[parent],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01525       pos = parent;
01526     }
01527     else
01528       return;
01529   }
01530 }
01531 
01532 /* input state: pipe_num is the number of elements in the heap
01533    prior to removing the root node. */
01534 void core_exec_STM_t::ALU_heap_remove(struct uop_action_t * const pipe, const int pipe_num)
01535 {
01536   if(pipe_num == 1) /* only one node to remove */
01537   {
01538     pipe[1].uop = NULL;
01539     pipe[1].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01540     return;
01541   }
01542 
01543   pipe[1] = pipe[pipe_num]; /* move last node to root */
01544 
01545   /* delete previous last node */
01546   pipe[pipe_num].uop = NULL;
01547   pipe[pipe_num].pipe_exit_time = TICK_T_MAX;
01548 
01549   /* push node down until heap property re-established */
01550   int pos = 1;
01551   while(1)
01552   {
01553     int Lindex = pos<<1;     // index of left child
01554     int Rindex = (pos<<1)+1; // index of right child
01555     tick_t myValue = pipe[pos].pipe_exit_time;
01556 
01557     tick_t Lvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01558     tick_t Rvalue = TICK_T_MAX;
01559     if(Lindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01560       Lvalue = pipe[Lindex].pipe_exit_time;
01561     if(Rindex < pipe_num) /* valid index */
01562       Rvalue = pipe[Rindex].pipe_exit_time;
01563 
01564     if(((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue != TICK_T_MAX)) ||
01565        ((myValue > Rvalue) && (Rvalue != TICK_T_MAX)))
01566     {
01567       if(Rvalue == TICK_T_MAX) /* swap pos with L */
01568       {
01569         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01570         return;
01571       }
01572       else if((myValue > Lvalue) && (Lvalue > Rvalue))
01573       {
01574         memswap(&pipe[Lindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01575         pos = Lindex;
01576       }
01577       else /* swap pos with R */
01578       {
01579         memswap(&pipe[Rindex],&pipe[pos],sizeof(*pipe));
01580         pos = Rindex;
01581       }
01582     }
01583     else
01584       return;
01585   }
01586 }
